summary: This is an email chain from January 2020 discussing the preparation of subpoenas to multiple airlines for flight records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence shows coordination to obtain travel data while expressing concerns about maintaining confidentiality.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email discusses obtaining subpoenas for her flight records from multiple airlines, using identifiers including her name and DOB for the periods 1994-1998 and July 2019-present.

persons.name: Ghislaine Borgerson
persons.context: Listed as an alternate identifier for Ghislaine Maxwell in the subpoena request for airline records.

connections.description: Ghislaine Borgerson is listed as an alternate name/identifier for Ghislaine Maxwell in the subpoena request.

events.title: Email coordination for subpoena preparation
events.description: Email correspondence discussing preparation of subpoenas for airline flight records and confirming confidentiality with airline contacts.

events.title: Follow-up on subpoena requests
events.description: Follow-up email confirming plans to make calls to airlines regarding subpoena requests for flight/travel records.

locations: 4333 Amon Carter Blvd. Ft. Worth, TX 76155
2701 Queens Plaza N., Suite 1 Long Island City, NY 11101
keyFacts: Investigators were seeking subpoenas in January 2020 for flight records of Ghislaine Maxwell from multiple major airlines including Delta, American, Alaska, Southwest, United, and JetBlue.
The subpoena requests covered two time periods: 1994-1998 and July 2019 to present (January 2020).
Investigators expressed concern about maintaining confidentiality when serving subpoenas naming Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document shows active investigation into Maxwell's travel patterns approximately six months before her arrest in July 2020.
Ghislaine Borgerson is listed as an alternate identifier for Ghislaine Maxwell in the subpoena requests.
